# 10. Visualization in space: Maps

Spatial visualization can be [pretty complex](http://youtu.be/XU6-krsDviY), because you have to manipulate learn new measures that apply in geographic contexts. We will stick to simply [viewing some data on a map](http://is-r.tumblr.com/post/35200999886/make-your-own-electoral-map).

Here's a quick method:

```{r easy-map}
library(maps)
library(ggplot2)
eu <- map_data("world", zoom = 4)
qog <- read.csv("data/qog_cs.csv", sep = ";", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
qog <- with(qog, data.frame(
  region = cname,
  fertility = wdi_fr, stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
eu <- merge(eu, qog, all.x = TRUE, by.x = "region", by.y = "region")
qplot(data = eu, x = long, y = lat, group = group, fill = fertility, geom = "polygon")
```
